email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and an LOA of 280 meters. The laycan is October 15-20. The starting freight rate is in the low 50s ($50.50 per metric ton). Let me know if this works for you or if you’d like to discuss further. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit higher than we were hoping for. Would you be able to come down to the mid-40s? Also, can you confirm the demurrage rate? Looking forward to your reply. Cheers, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I understand your concerns about the rate. After discussing with the owner, we can offer $48.75 per metric ton. The demurrage rate is $25,000 per day, pro rata. Let me know if this is acceptable. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the revised offer. $48.75 works for us, but we’d like to cap the demurrage at $20,000 per day. Also, can we confirm the laycan as October 15-20? Let me know if this is agreeable. Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I’ve confirmed with the owner, and we can agree to cap the demurrage at $20,000 per day. The laycan remains October 15-20. If everything looks good, I’ll draft the charter party agreement. Let me know if you need anything else. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, everything looks good on our end. Please proceed with drafting the charter party agreement. Thanks for your help on this. Cheers, John
